sentence.text: The first wells were set alight in February 1991 and their smoke plumes were clearly visible on satellite images of the region .
Thieves , having stolen a car , take it for a joy ride and then strip it before setting it alight to destroy the evidence .
Fire horror : A woman has died from burns after apparently dousing herself with petrol and setting it alight at an address in Bell Street , Hindley , near Wigan .

The rocks missed him , yet Jack did not give up and set alight the forest .
An effigy of Bartle , said to be a medieval sheep thief , though undoubtedly a much older figure , is paraded round the village after dark and then set alight .
A stolen car which was set alight at Acklam Rugby Club , Saltersgill Avenue , Middlesbrough , damaged part of the pitch .
IN A WOOD in South Ockendon , Essex , on the very outskirts of London , two brothers spend their days cutting dead timber , loading it into a steel kiln and setting it alight .
Officers who are unfortunately set alight by petrol bombs should not run down the road screaming , but should lay down with dignity and await their turn to be put out .
This Dutch barn near Banbury was set alight last September .
Staff and customers watched in horror as he poured the petrol over himself and set himself alight .
She also set two rubbish bins alight to bring out the fire brigade .
They tied him into the car and set it alight .
I considered setting the whin bushes alight , but the flowers always looked cheerful when they came out , and the bushes smelled better fresh than burned , so I did n't .
